poem:
### In Memoriam of Injustice

This cold cell,  
cries of tethered souls,  
a whispered plea—a mother's voice,  
lost in shadows of stone walls.  
Ten days, no grace of cloth,  
silence holds—a cruel refrain.  
Justice falters,  
as petals fall, unseen.  
Reform, the tear-stained echo,  
begs in the brittle dawn.
